alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 3:51PM EDT until June 26 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MONROE COUNTY... At 251 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Tompkinsville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Monroe County, including the following locations... Forkton, Blythe, Harlan Crossroads, Otia, Grandview, Hestand and Vernon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
